thread.title: Pubs try and cash in after Liam Gallagher Twitter sulk
thread.title_full: Pubs try and cash in after Liam Gallagher Twitter sulk | Granada - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Pubs try and cash in after Liam Gallagher Twitter sulk
text:
Rival pubs are trying to cash in on Liam Gallagher’s Twitter rant about a Stockport bar’s strict dress code.
On Sunday night the former Oasis frontman was allegedly barred from drinking in The Elizabethan, in Heaton Moor, because one of his group was wearing tracksuit bottoms.
Liam took to Twitter to vent his fury and told his followers the pub won’t let drinkers in unless they are dressed in a “Gucci bath robe”.
The tweet said:
Credit: MEN Syndication Following his tirade several pubs and bars in the area responded by inviting the singer in for a drink, regardless of what he is wearing.
And The Plough on the Moor, on Heaton Moor Road, took it one step forward by posting a message on their chalkboard outside writing:
Credit: MEN Syndication Some of our team members were having a bit of a laugh.
We think it is a bit of a laugh more than anything, we don’t have a dress code.
– Callum Hartley, manager, The Plough on the Moor Others Tweeted the star to invite him down to their various establishments.
Come to the Savoy down the road, Gucci bathrobe not compulsory, trackies optional, respect guaranteed...Sing showing-perfect.
– The Savoy Cinema Other venues also tried to entice Liam to visit. The Savoy Cinema posted on Twitter:
And Reasons to be Cheerful Beer Cafe Tweeted to the former Oasis frontman:
Why you drinking in Heaton Moor when there’s a perfectly good bar on your doorstep in Burnage :) we don’t discriminate!
– Reasons to be Cheerful Beer Cafe Last updated Tue 21 Stockport Manchester
